goal: Pangea Public Affairs offers services relating to regulatory interest representation at EU level, networking, organisation of meetings and events, training and  coaching, political and strategical support to organisations.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Digital economy and society, Employment and Social Affairs, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Fraud prevention, Institutional affairs, Public Health, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Youth
euInitiatives:
We are currently monitoring EU legislative initiatives relating to the gaming industry, namely:
Legislative follow up to the EC Communication on the European Framework for online gambling (COM (2012) 596 final) and the Council Recommendation on principles for the protection of consumers and players of online gambling services and for the prevention of minors from gambling online (2014/478/EU);
Process on the preparation of a CEN standard regarding reporting of illegal gambling;
Proposal COM (2017) 0386 re: the Council of Europe Convention on the manipulation of sports competitions with regard to matters related to substantive criminal law and judicial cooperation in criminal matters (against match fixing);
Implementation of the anti money laundering Directive (2015/849/EU) and its amendments
Implementation of the review of the Audiovisual Media Services Directive;
Implementation of the Geo-blocking Regulation (EU) 2018/302;
Implementation of the Regulation of the free flow of non- personal data;
Consumer package;
Fair Taxation of the Digital Economy - proposals of 2018;
Trade policy, FTAs;
Brexit negotiations.
